ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My writing skills have greatly improved from this class and the feedback was very beneficial.
I learned a lot about my own writing style. I learned where I struggle the most in the essay process, and I can now work more on how to improve these skills.

I learned how to write in a more structured way than I was used to. This course developed my critical thinking skills, as I was required to respond to specific prompts about beauty and art. Because this course focused on the singular topic of beauty, my skills were able to develop at a quicker rate than they would in a class with broader, or more topics. With each assignment I felt that my analysis and depth was improving.

I learned so much about beauty, for one thing. Having never previously engaged with art history, a major component of the class, it was interesting to be bombarded with . We worked a lot on honing our writing skills, especially writing in active voice. A wonderful learning experience!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: My overall writing skills improved and this was a great introductory class to take my first semester.

I loved the topic of this course. I thought our discussions were captivating and thought-provoking, and I ended up thinking about a lot of our conversations outside of class. The readings assigned were very interesting and diverse, and I loved being pushed to think about beauty in different ways.
I think that at times, some readings did not align well with the topics at hand. I definitely think some could have been eliminated to make the subject more clear.

The workload in the beginning is a lot, but once it dies down a bit, the class becomes genuinely fun. I loved the workshopping models and the individualized time taken to work by oneself or with partners. I've made a great friendship out of the class, and this is a testament to the close relationships we are encouraged to build with one another in order to ensure greater writing skills.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes it was very effective in helping my writing be on the college level.
I would highly recommend this course because of the topic and Ms. Jones's teaching style.
Yes, if they like the topic and want a class to help them better their writing skills.

Absolutely, as long as you're willing to put the work in. The amount of reading in the beginning can be a little intense, but it really dies down after the first month. The content is interesting, the discussions are great, and we all loved Ms. Jones. You get out what you put into it, and I have become a much stronger writer for having taken this class.
